message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper deals with natural language processing (NLP) and proposes a new neural network layer for handling out-of-vocabulary (OOV) words. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also involves deep learning techniques and model optimization, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper proposes a new method for generating task-specific and sentence-dependent OOV word representations, which could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also involves attention mechanisms, which could suggest cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper evaluates its method on tagging tasks, which could suggest cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition).
